Robin Rendle
NotesEssaysAdventures
November 29, 2015 • Plymouth, UK

Longform

I’ve been listening to the interviews on Longform over the past week—in between cleaning, working, heading to the gym—and they’ve been so consistently insightful. Here are my favourites so far:

  • George Saunders on ‘the long corridor’ and recognising how difficult and time consuming it is to make something great.
  • Ta-Nehisi Coates on his book Between the World and Me which I’ve just ordered and cannot wait to dig into. I also checked out an older episode where Ta-Nehisi talks about how “writers can’t assume that their work is going to cause change”.
  • Rukmini Callimachi on covering ISIS for the NYT.
